text: Lead telluride, also known as lead(II) telluride, is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is PbTe. It contains lead and telluride ions. The lead is in the +2 oxidation state. ==Properties== Lead telluride is a gray crystalline solid. It reacts with strong acids to make toxic hydrogen telluride and toxic lead salts. ==Preparation== It may be made by melting lead and tellurium together. ==Uses== It is used as a semiconductor and an infrared detector. ==Related pages== *Sodium telluride ==References== Category:Tellurium compounds
title: Lead telluride
